item.title: Cancer numbers
item.description: These numbers are based on Cancer Statistics 2017, partly projections for 2017 in the US. Incidence The cancers with the highest incidence are prostate cancer in man (20%) and breast cancer in woman (30%). The second and third are lung and colon cancer. Death Lung cancer is by far the most deadly cancer, responsible for 25-27% of cancer deaths. It is followed by colon cancer and prostate/breast in male/female.
